definition: singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet

sentences.english: I don't know what season's singing is so loud and clear.
sentences.chinese: 不知道是什么季节的歌声才那么嘹亮。

sentences.english: A burst of hand-clapping followed the end of the song.
sentences.chinese: 歌声结束后是一阵热烈的掌声。

sentences.english: and make that season of ice and snow more endurable.
sentences.chinese: 那歌声使冰天雪地的寒冬变得较易忍受。

sentences.english: The cheerful song full of the whole classroom.
sentences.chinese: 欢快的歌声充满了整间教室。

sentences.english: I hear the song of the nightingales, and I smell crushed mulberries.
sentences.chinese: 我听见夜莺的歌声，我闻到压碎的桑葚味道。

sentences.english: They raise the national flag and the national hymn starts.
Joyful songs are still around our ears, cheerful drums are still in our hearts.
sentences.chinese: 愉悦的歌声还回荡在耳畔，快乐的鼓点还奏响在心中。

sentences.english: And, dying, it rises above its own agony to outcarol the lark and the nightingale.
sentences.chinese: 它超脱了垂死的剧痛，歌声胜过百灵和夜莺。

sentences.english: It seems that other tone-deaf people also have concerns about God not understanding their silence in song.
sentences.chinese: 他也是个音盲，也担心上帝听不到他的歌声。

sentences.english: And that might explain why the pitch of their songs has gotten lower.
sentences.chinese: 这也是它们歌声音调变低的原因。

sentences.english: In the rain, a 11)blackbird was singing beautifully.
sentences.chinese: 在雨中，一只乌鸫正在鸣唱，歌声优美动听。

sentences.english: She said mermaids sang much better than people.
sentences.chinese: 她说美人鱼的歌声要比人类好太多了。

sentences.english: Faint winds, and a song fading and leaves falling.
sentences.chinese: 无力的风，歌声渐弱，落叶潇潇。

sentences.english: Contestants mesmerised by their own singing.
sentences.chinese: 参赛者陶醉在自己的歌声中。

sentences.english: As it Dongmei sang songs of early spring.
sentences.chinese: 就象那冬梅吟唱着早春的歌声。

definition: to sing opera music (without staging or make up)
high-pitched and penetrating (musical instrument, voice etc)/high-spirited/fever-pitched (atmosphere)
